div.p:
College of Arts and Science
Aided By Govt of Kerala
Affiliated to the University of Calicut
Reacredited by NAAC with A Grade

The Government of Kerala has introduced various scholarships awarded to meritorious students of outstanding performance in the education sector as well as to the students of socially and economically backward categories. The Higher Education Department of Government of Kerala is entrusted with the responsibility of selection and disbursement of various scholarships to Under Graduate and Post Graduate Streams. The college has a very active Scholarship Cell to give the students timely information and guidance on various scholarships and freeships they are entitled to., Mr. Mohamed Sadiqu P.A. Assistant Professor, Department of Arabic is the Nodal Officer of Scholarships at the college. Our students have received many scholarships being offered by various government and non-governmental agencies.Our College sponsored Shihab Thangal Memorial Fellowship, State Merit Scholarship, Suvarna Jubilee Merit Scholarship, Blind/PH Scholarship, Higher Education Scholarship, Central Sector Scholarship, Snehapoorvam Scholarship, Postmatric Scholarship, Muslim Girls Scholarship, CH Muhammed Koya Scholarship, Indian Jeeva Karunya Trust scholarship are a few to mention.

div.h5: Post Matric Scholarships Scheme for Minorities

div.h2: What is Post Matric Scholarships Scheme for Minorities ?
div.p: Ministry of Minority Affairs, Government of India, invites applications from class 11 to PhD students of minority communities for Post Matric Scholarships Scheme for Minorities .The scholarship aims to encourage meritorious students of economically weaker sections of the minority community to pursue higher education and enhance their employability by providing financial assistance.
The scholarship is being offered by the Ministry of Minor Read More

The Suvarna Jubilee Merit Scholarship for UG/PG studies is started by Kerala government (Department of Collegiate Education) for students of Kerala those who belong to economically poor family i.e. BPL (Below Poverty Line) to pursue higher education like graduation and post graduation.
Link to Apply : http://www.dcescholarship.kerala.gov.in

Shihab Thangal Memorial Fellowship is a PTA generated monitory support scheme for the economically backward but academically forward students in EMEA college, which has been there for almost one decade. On this year 2019, PTA could provide Rs. 5000 for 30 students pursuing various courses.

C H Muhammedkoya Scholarship(MGS) is a state level scholarship . Student should be a GIRL student studying for the first year of Graduation or Higher courses in Govt./ Aided Institution and should belong to MUSLIM , Latin, Converted Christian community and should be a native of Kerala.Family Annual income should not exceed 4.50 Lakhs.
Link to Apply : http://www.dcescholarship.kerala.gov.in

div.h5: Single Girl Child Scholarship for PG students

div.p: Single Girl Child Scholarship for PG students.Scholarship given by UGC to one and only girl child pursuing PG Courses.
Link to Apply : https://www.ugc.ac.in/

div.p: Department of Collegiate Education, Government of Kerala invites applications for District Merit Scholarship (DMS), Kerala from meritorious students studying in higher secondary, VHSC, ITI or polytechnic courses. Selected students will receive INR 1,250 per annum.
